title: IRC Archive for channel #xwiki on 15 January 2013 - XWiki
content:

10:26 <msmeria> tmortagne: regarding XWIKI-8682 do you want me to test on the snapshot found here http://maven.xwiki.org/snapshots/org/xwiki/manager/xwiki-manager-web/4.4-SNAPSHOT/ ? I'm asking beacause it appears as being  Last modified on 10jan  
10:31 <tmortagne> XEM job deos not seems to be linked to XE job  
10:33 <tmortagne> mflorea: you can check here when it's ready  
10:35 <mflorea> tmortagne: what to check?  
10:36 <tmortagne> not sure if that job was created with the script of by hand  
10:37 <mflorea> I think you meant msmeria  
10:39 <jvdrean> has joined #xwiki

10:47 <vmassol> it's a copy + changes  
10:47 <vmassol> in 2 places: branch + change job deps  
10:47 <tmortagne> ok  
10:47 <tmortagne> is XEM job created after XE job ?

10:47 <vmassol> just checked that ;)

13:56 <AndreasJonsson> has joined #xwiki  
14:12 <xwikibot> has joined #xwiki  
14:15 <cjd> tmortagne: hi, re my earlier question on the list, is it possible to allow xwiki.org to import from arbitrary mvn repos without having to change the xwiki.properties file and restart it each time?  
14:29 <tmortagne> cjd: with a script you can request any repository but the current import UI does not support it  
14:31 <tmortagne> hmm wait  
14:32 <cjd> If it's just the UI then I'll look at improving it so that I can shorten the instructions list for making an extension  
14:32 <tmortagne> the real API allows it but the repository scipt service only take the repository id  
14:32 <cjd> hmm  
14:32 <tmortagne> so in other words you cpan do it in groovy but not velocity  
14:32 <tmortagne> s/cpan/can/  
14:32 <cjd> Ahh so we can do it pretty easily for xwiki.org  
14:33 <tmortagne> yep  
14:33 <tmortagne> can do it in groovy for now and add official support for it in the script service on github  
14:33 <cjd> I think the best way is to have new extension contributers use mvn deploy into a directory and then gut push that to github.  
14:33 <tmortagne> for when we upgrade xwiki.org  
14:33 <cjd> \*git  
14:34 <cjd> Asking a contributer to request permission to deploy on nexus is a nonstarter IMO  
14:36 <tmortagne> we could do what is done for maven central, your user is associated to some group id and automatically promoted  
14:36 <tmortagne> so you ask only the first time  
14:37 <cjd> I'd rather if people didn't have to ask at all because the major learning curve and the biggest risk of someone walking away is during that first critical extension.  
14:37 <cjd> once they can do one, they have mastered it  
14:38 <tmortagne> well then I'm not sure what you propose ? anyone can deploy anything ?  
14:39 <cjd> Deploy to a local directory and then push to your own github repo, since github has a "raw" mode, you can point maven at a github repo and it will work.  
14:40 <tmortagne> so you would have to have your own maven repository to import an extension ?  
14:41 <tmortagne> (whatever the way you do your maven repository)  
14:41 <vmassol> cjd: you're aware that you can use your local maven repo to try your extension right?  
14:41 <cjd> vmassol: you mean by adding it to your xwiki.properties ?  I was not aware of it but that's good.  
14:42 <vmassol> I do that all the time when testing extensions  
14:42 <tmortagne> cjd: that's because the local maven repository is a valid maven repository  
14:42 <cjd> https://github.com/cjdelisle/my-first-xwiki-extension/blob/master/pom.xml#L67 <-- this is what I'm trying at the moment, it makes for a very short instructions list for publishing  
14:42 <cjd> it's just that we need to allow 1 repository per extension  
14:43 <vmassol> 1 repo per extension is really bad for perf  
14:44 <vmassol> bbiab  
15:00 <cjd> 1 repo per extension shouldn't have to be bad performance, maven protocol does require asking every repository for every artifact but it seems that the EM could be more intelligent.  
15:01 <cjd> The problem as I see it is people are going to be asking "why can't it be fast \*and\* easy like node.js and golang" and "those languages are toys they are not enterprise" may be true now but it won't be forever.  
15:02 <mflorea> has joined #xwiki  
15:24 <cjd> has quit  
15:38 <vmassol> jvdrean: could you look at the failing UIExtension test?  
15:38 <vmassol> expected:<...World HelloWikiWorld[1 HelloWikiWorld2 {HelloWorldKey=HelloWorldValue} {HelloWikiWorldKey=zz1\_XWiki.superadmin]} {HelloWikiWorldKey...> but was:<...World HelloWikiWorld[2 {HelloWorldKey=HelloWorldValue]} {HelloWikiWorldKey...>  
15:59 <jvdrean> vmassol: I can't right now but I will ASAP  
16:00 <vmassol> breaking the build is top priority  
16:17 <qwebirc17204> has joined #xwiki  
16:26 <qwebirc17204> Hey, how can I set velocity variables from a groovy file which calls something like:  String renderedContent = anotherDoc.getRenderedContent("Hello $msgdoc.get('title')", "xwiki/1.0");  I tried it with context.put("msgdoc", xwiki.getDocument("Test/Doc") and xcontext.put("msgdoc"... but the title is never fetched  
16:27 <jvdrean1> has joined #xwiki  
16:30 <jvdrean> has quit  
16:34 <tmortagne> qwebirc17204: what version is it ? since 4.0 you can simply do http://platform.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/DevGuide/Scripting#HSharevariablebetweenlanguages  
16:35 <tmortagne> (works on groovy -> velocity way right now and not the other way yet)  
16:36 <tmortagne> before 4.0 going trough xcontext should work AFAIK  
16:36 <tmortagne> groovy:  
16:36 <tmortagne> velocity:  
16:36 <tmortagne> $xcontext.somevar  
16:38 <tmortagne> qwebirc17204: its put() actually, not set()  
16:41 <polx> has quit  
16:44 <qwebirc17204> tmortagne: thank you  
16:44 <qwebirc17204> if I call anotherDoc.getRenderedContent("\$context.somevalue", "xwiki/1.0");  
16:44 <qwebirc17204> where some value is a Document  
16:44 <qwebirc17204> it should produce the tostring representation correct?  
16:45 <qwebirc17204> (with the object in context indeed)  
16:45 <GuillaumeF> has joined #xwiki  
16:45 <qwebirc17204> But it pruces "$context.somevalue" for me  
16:49 <tmortagne> it's possible anotherDoc.getRenderedContent is creating a new context I think and is executed in an isolated way  
16:52 <tmortagne> so they don't share the same xcontext instance  
16:53 <qwebirc17204> yes that would be a reason, but how to pass "parameters" in such a case? Avoid foreign rendering?  
16:54 <tmortagne> you can probably directly use the xwiki/1.0 rendering framework from groovy instead of going through getRenderedContent unless this was just an example  
16:56 <evalica> has quit  
17:03 <Enygma`> has quit  
17:14 <msmeria> has quit  
17:38 <polx> has joined #xwiki  
17:58 <qwebirc17204> Hey, how to obtain a converter from componentManager in version 3.5?  
17:59 <vmassol> cm.lookup(...)
